body.quiz: Which of the words that the following images represent have the same character as the second character in the word presented?
body.answer: Image of garbage can©iStock
options: Image of a pair of winter gloves ©iStock
Image of a mirror©iStock
Image of a fridge©iStock
body.correct: You got it! The second character of the word 马桶 mǎtǒng (toilet) is 桶 tǒng, which is the same as the third character in the word 垃圾桶 lājītǒng (garbage can).
body.incorrect: Very close. Listen to the audio several times to identify the word, and then identify its second character. Then, find the words that the images in the choices represent, and compare their characters.

body.quiz: Which of the following bold type characters have the same final as the second character of the word in the audio?
body.correct: Fabulous job! The second character in the word 毛巾 máojīn (towel) has the final “in,” which is also shared by the first character 金 jīn in the word 金色 jīnsè (gold/blonde).
body.incorrect: Not quite. Listen to the word in the audio several times to identify the final of its second character, and then sound out the words in the choices to see which one shares the same final.

body.quiz: Which of the following is most likely made of the same material as the item indicated by the word in the audio?
body.correct: Fabulous job! 卫生纸, wèishēngzhǐ means “toilet paper,” and of the items in the choices, books are made of paper as well.
body.incorrect: Oops. First identify the meaning of the word in the audio. Then, consider what material it is made of, and examine the items in the choices to see which one uses the same material.

body.quiz: Which of the following sentences can be least reasonably completed with the word presented?
body.answer: 我在卧室_____床。 Wǒ zài wòshì _____ chuáng.
options: 他在厨房_____牛奶。 Tā zài chúfán _____ niúnǎi.
我妹妹在浴室_____水。 Wǒ mèimei zài yùshì _____ shuǐ.
她今天下午_____垃圾。 Tā jīntiān xiàwǔ _____ lājī.
body.correct: How excellent! The word 倒 dào means “to empty out/to pour out.” Of the sentences in the choices, the item that’s least likely to be poured or emptied out would be the bed in the sentence 我在卧室_____床。 Wǒ zài wòshì _____ chuáng. I am ____ the bed in the bedroom. An ideal verb for this sentence would be 整理 zhěnglǐ (to tidy up).
body.incorrect: Not quite…Think about the meaning of the word in the audio. Then, consider in which sentences it can reasonably fit and which one it can’t.
